channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Bins permanently stored on verge, 17th December
item.description:
Bins have been there for several months, permanently kept on the verge. There have now been two occasions Iâ€™ve been unable to pass due to the bins blown over by the strong winds across the path and cars always parked along this stretch of path. I have seen people with pushchairs and. Mobility scooters having to cross the busy road to get around.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 106, Welch Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Noise Noise Noise !!, 17th December
item.description:
The newley repaired/installed Surface water drain is now more vocal than ever ! This has had 3 attempted fixes & somehow' None have been successful! Must be costing a fortune' not a road engineer but surely why can't a permanent fix be applied, it's driving us residents crazy !!! Reply please.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing sigage Bollard for crossing, 17th December
item.description:
It looks like this may now be being resolved, but on Sunday, 16th November, due to the missing bollard, my wife was unable to see the kerb and as a result damaged two tyres irreparably. Please can this be fixed and please can you tell me where I make the claim for the damage caused to the car as a result of this missing essential road sinage?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 185, Hewlett Road, Battledown, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Surface is damaged problem, 17th December
item.description:
The owner of the barn (Located behind number 3 Treddington Park) has had a few deliveries from Smiths and they are delivering what looks like some hard core material onto the bridleway to potentialy turn it into a vechile access, the customer beleives the owner is going through getting planning permison as well.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole and poor road near allotment retaining wall, 17th December
item.description:
Hello, I'm reporting this on behalf of Charlton Kings Parish Council. Heading south on the left side of the road first there is a large pothole near stone allotments retaining wall and then there is a patch of road in poor condition on the left near the entrance to the cemetery. This is of particular concern as we have been advised the retaining wall at the allotments is being weakened due to water ingress spraying from the potholes in the road. It will cost us a substantial amount to rebuild the wall and repairing these potholes will prevent further degradation of the structure. Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 128, Horsefair Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: The drain is blocked problem, 17th December
item.description:
I live in the house directly opposite the temporary access for your Harp Hill site in Cheltenham (Beech House). Firstly, I have a number of positive things to say about the gentleman who sits managing the site who is very helpful, polite and does his best. However, as you can see from the state of the verges directly outside our property, there is some remedial work now required. Very large lorries are unable to make the turn (or reverse swing) into the temporary access which has meant they have driven all over the verge and used our drive to enable their turn, including pushing large amounts of earth across and into the drainage ditch (and deepening potholes). As a result, water collects in a pool at the end of our driveway as it is unable to flow through the pipe hidden under the mess that is normally full visible (as shown by the last photo). The ditch now needs re-digging out and the verge making good. Please could Vistry work together with Highways to come up with something to prevent this repeating and to sort the immediate drainage issue? We are concerned that if weather conditions should turn icy that it would be extremely dangerous to pull out of our driveway. We would appreciate some direct contact with Vistry group as it is impossible to find any more suitable email addresses from your website. We fully anticipate that there may be issues in the future for which it would be great to have a point of contact. Please feel free to contact us on 07534 020301. Kind regards, Jenna and David Gurteen
Report on FixMyStreet
